title: TTSOps: A Closed-Loop Corpus Optimization Framework for Training Multi-Speaker TTS Models from Dark Data
author: Kentaro Seki (University of Tokyo), Shinnosuke Takamichi (University of Tokyo), Saeki Takaaki (University of Tokyo), Hiroshi Saruwatari (University of Tokyo), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses a method for optimizing corpus construction for text-to-speech systems, which can inform similar approaches in audio processing and generation tasks, such as speech enhancement methods relevant to Haohe's work.
background: This research focuses on creating high-quality, diverse multi-speaker text-to-speech systems using poorly labeled web data by evaluating and optimizing training data selection and cleansing through an automated feedback loop.
contribution: This paper introduces TTSOps, a closed-loop framework for optimizing the training corpus, leveraging dark data to improve performance in text-to-speech synthesis models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often rely on fixed data quality metrics without considering model robustness to noise or variations in data quality during training.
technical_comparison.novelty: TTSOps dynamically selects the most suitable data cleansing method and incorporates an evaluation-in-the-loop strategy to adaptively filter training data based on its expected contribution to model performance.

key_innovation: The unique integration of model-aware evaluation and adaptive data cleansing creates a highly efficient pipeline for handling diverse and noisy datasets.
real_world_impact: The proposed framework allows the construction of more robust TTS systems from real-world data, increasing accessibility and usability in applications such as voice assistants and content creation.
limitations: While the framework is promising, its dependency on pseudo Mean Opinion Scores for quality assessment may limit accuracy in certain cases.

new_terms.dark data: **Dark data** refers to large volumes of unstructured data that are generated but not structured or labeled for specific tasks, which poses challenges for traditional data processing techniques.
new_terms.mean opinion score (MOS): **Mean Opinion Score (MOS)** is a widely used metric for assessing the quality of synthesized speech based on human perceptual ratings.
